snippet: Avi Dichter, an old army friend of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from a rival political party, will resign his seat in Parliament to join Mr. Netanyahu’s government.
abstract: Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu of Israel names Avi Dichter, an old army friend from a rival political party, as his new home front minister, amid growing concern about preparedness for the response to a potential attack on Iran.

byline.contributor: Thomas Erdbrink contributed reporting from Tehran.

lead_paragraph: Avi Dichter, an old army friend of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu from a rival political party, will resign his seat in Parliament to join Mr. Netanyahu’s government.

headline.seo: Avi Dichter Named Israeli Home Front Minister
headline.main: Israel Names New Home Front Minister
headline.print_headline: Israel Names New Minister To Oversee Home Front
